review_title: No room for growth  but great benefits.
job_title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative in Anaheim Hills, CA
pros: Great Benefits, 2 week vacations during the holidays, and beautiful work environment.
cons: office politics, no room for growth, the work schedule is worst. you may need to work until 8pm some days and you must work Saturdays.

pros: Small Campus, easy to interact with students, staff, and faculty
cons: Politics: Everyone gossips in this place and if you get on the wrong side of leadership, you will have a terrible time. The President, VP of Student Affairs, VP of Academic Affairs, VP of Marketing, and more are a group of white women who are very close friends outside of work and they run the show. If you work here and accidentally get on any of their bad sides, they will use their power to make your life miserable. I have never worked somewhere with a larger collection of two-faced, authoritarian leaders. Any talk of diversity or equity at this place is a complete farce, they just load up with white family members and friends in leadership positions and fill in the people of color at the bottom to try to make up for it.

review_title: Good Pay, Nice Faculty, Difficult Staff
pros: Good pay starting out, some of the faculty were nice.
cons: The departments do not like eachother, (Opt, PA, Pharm). Like weird high school cliques. Because of this  Simple things like updating student records can be complicated because they dont like staff from newer programs boy optometry.
